snippet: The I.R.S. is asking Tea Party groups applying for nonprofit tax status to prove that they are “social welfare” organizations and not the political activists they obviously are.
abstract: Editorial lauds the IRS for requiring that Tea Party chapters applying for nonprofit tax status prove they are 'social welfare' organizations; contends such groups are transparently political organizations that give generously to campaigns; urges the IRS not to flinch from its duty to enforce the tax code and root out political operatives who are abusing the law and conning taxpayers and voters.
lead_paragraph: The I.R.S. is asking Tea Party groups applying for nonprofit tax status to prove that they are “social welfare” organizations and not the political activists they obviously are.
